newsitem.title: USA: US OPTIONS FOCUS/Netscape, Motorola are highlights.
newsitem.headline: US OPTIONS FOCUS/Netscape, Motorola are highlights.

text.p: Options on technology companies Netscape Communications Corp and Motorola Inc saw brisk trade Wednesday, one after the stock fell sharply and one ahead of quarterly earnings.
By 1145 CST/1745 GMT, Netscape shares were off 9-3/8 at 49-3/8 on heavy turnover of 9.1 million shares after Deutsche Morgan Grenfell downgraded the stock to accumulate from buy.
The stock hit a session low of 49-1/4.
Traders said options investors appeared to take the drop in stride and were not positioning themselves for more losses.
"Our order flow is telling us it's a little overreaction," said Scott Kilrea of LETCO on the floor of the Chicago Board Options Exchange.
"There are more premium sellers than premium buyers and that would tell me the public doesn't think it's going to be as volatile as $8 or $9."
He said Netscape options volatilities rose slightly off the opening but came right back down.
Hank Nothnagel, senior vice president of options trading at EVEREN Securities in Chicago, said his options desk had crossed a considerable number of Netscape options.
"Surprisingly enough, we had a lot of call buyers," he said. "I don't know if they're right or wrong."

Among Netscape calls, the January 55 traded a total of about 3,295 contracts, the January 50 traded about 2,790 and the January 60 call traded 681. The busiest put was the January 50, which traded roughly 2,780 contracts.
Netscape options trade on the CBOE, the American Stock Exchange, the Philadelphia Stock Exchange and the Pacific Stock Exchange.
Motorola gained two to 63-1/2 in heavy trading after Morgan Stanley raised its rating to outperform from neutral.

The company is expected to post lower fourth quarter earnings after the market closes on Thursday, but analysts are looking for any signs of a rebound in new semiconductor orders and in its wireless phone business.
Traders said the options activity was skewed toward the call side, which was not surprising given the stock's rise.
The January 65 call was the most active, with volume of more than 4,300 contracts. The January 70 call traded about 2,430 and the January 60 call traded 1,665.
The most active Motorola put was the January 60, with volume of about 2,490 contracts.
"We haven't had any put buyers come in," one trader said, referring to Motorola and other technology companies slated to report earnings soon. "That's pretty much where the risk is."
He said below-consensus earnings would likely cause sharp selloffs and strong earnings would lead to further rallies.
In other trading, some of the sharpest options moves were seen in Shiva Corp as the stock slumped 14-7/8 to 20 after a late Tuesday warning about fourth quarter earnings.
A call spread in Liposome Co Inc crossed 6,150 times in the May 17-1/2 and 4,320 times in the August 20. ((-G.Crawford, 312 408 8750/Email: derivatives@reuters.com))
